alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County; Northern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued June 19 at 1:47AM PDT until June 19 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 11 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 38 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible. * WHERE...Humboldt County and Northern Elko County. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 8 AM PDT this morning. For the Wind Advisory, from 11 AM this morning to 11 PM PDT this evening. For the Freeze Watch, from late tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. A few power outages are possible. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
